#Text=Follow Singaporean Food Etiquette
#Text=Singapore is dubbed the " Food Paradise " by people all over the world .

column1: #Text=Many delicacies and good food from all over the world can be found in Singapore .
#Text=Here we will show two common yet unique ways of eating non-local food and more conventional foods in Singapore , using your hand and chopsticks .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Indian and Muslim food ( hand )
#Text=Indian and Muslim food like nasi briyani , roti prata , nasi lemak and nasi padang are usually consumed using the hand by the locals .
#Text=They are taught to use their right hand only when taking the food .
#Text=Use only your right hand .
#Text=Use your thumb , index finger and middle finger to grasp the food .
#Text=Only your fingers should come in contact with the food .
#Text=Keep hand contact to the food to the minimal .
#Text=The thumb of the hand is used to " push " or " guide " the food into your mouth .
#Text=When consuming roti prata , you should tear the prata with one hand only .
#Text=Using your thumb and index finger , tear a piece of the prata off , and then scoop the curry or the vegetables , with the bread and then eat .
#Text=It is incorrect , and inelegant to eat the curry and the bread separately .
#Text=Chinese food ( chopsticks )
#Text=Chopsticks are naturally believed to have originated in the olden days of China .
#Text=The traditional eating tools are a pair of small identical , even-length tapered sticks .
#Text=Put one chopstick between the palm and the base of the thumb , using the ring finger ( the fourth finger ) to support the lower part of the stick .
#Text=With the thumb , grip the stick down while the ring finger pushes it up .
#Text=The stick should be steady and very stable .
#Text=Use the edge of the thumb , index and middle fingers to sustain the other stick like a pen .
#Text=Make sure the tips of the two sticks line up .
#Text=Balance the upper stick up and down towards the stationary lower stick .
#Text=With this oscillation one can pick up food of any amazing sizes !
#Text=With plenty of practice , the two sticks will serve like a pair of tongs .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Chopsticks generally should be held at the thicker end about one-third along their length for balance and accuracy .
#Text=For greater touch to pick up food further away , hold the chopsticks at the upper ends .
#Text=If the tips fail to its position , it will be difficult to hold things .

#Text=Hold the chopsticks upright with one of the tips lightly touching the table , and gently push the chopsticks down or gently loosen your grip for a moment to let both tips become equal in length .
#Text=You can also alter your grip or holding position this way .
#Text=With practice , it is likely to perform step one and two according on lifting up the chopsticks with one hand .
#Text=Adjust your grip if possible .
